thread.title: Netflix subscriber growth beats on strong original content

title: Netflix subscriber growth beats on strong original content
text:
April 16, 2018 / 8:10 PM / Updated 8 minutes ago Netflix subscriber growth beats on strong original content Reuters Staff 2 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Netflix Inc ( NFLX.O ) added more international subscribers than expected in the first quarter as a slate of original shows including “Altered Carbon” kept viewers hooked to the video streaming service provider. FILE PHOTO: The Netflix logo is shown in this illustration photograph in Encinitas, California, U.S., on October 14, 2014. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo 
Shares of the company, which have surged about 60 percent this year, rose 6 percent to $327.57 after the bell on Monday. 
Netflix, which faces stiff competition from Amazon.com’s ( AMZN.O ) Prime Video service and Hulu, has been pumping in funds to expand its portfolio of original content across different languages and strengthen its international presence. 
The Los Gatos, California-based company had said it plans to spend around $8 billion on content this year to boost its subscriber growth. 
Netflix added 5.46 million subscribers in its international markets in the first quarter ended March 31. compared with the average analyst estimate of 5.02 million, according to data and analytics firm FactSet. 
Netflix said it added 7.4 million total subscribers compared with the average analyst estimate of 6.5 million, according to FactSet. 
Net income rose to $290.1 million, or 64 cents per share, in the quarter ended March 31 from $178.2 million, or 40 cents per share, a year earlier. 
Total revenue rose 40.4 percent to $3.7 billion in the quarter. 
Analysts on average had expected a revenue of $3.69 billion, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S. Reporting by Laharee Chatterjee in Bengaluru; Editing by Arun Koyyur
